data.title: Why do old radios sometimes pick up radio stations from other countries instead of only picking up local radio stations?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 18): Most older radios are on the AM Broadcast Band, which goes from around 540 KHz to 1600 KHz. I may be a little off, but I am close.

This band is pretty long wave; an antenna for the highest frequency (1600 KHz) will be around 146 feet, and that is a quarter wave! So, the wave le...
